pullRequest.title: DEVX-1712: First tutorial for basic Kafka - console consumer and producer
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR adds a basic Kafka tutorial for using the console consumer/producer and covers:

Produce/consume your first message(s)
Consuming all records with --from-beginning
Using key-value pairs

This is the first of a series of basic Kafka operations tutorials
This PR also introduces some UI changes by adding a new card for Kafka only tutorials, as a result  the PR will need some formatting help and naming suggestions.
Addresses #340

nodes.bodyText: the whole tutorial works when going through all steps, but this part fails on the test harness, need to figure out why, but I'm not sure of the ROI.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,14 @@
+STEPS_DIR := tutorial-steps
+DEV_OUTPUTS_DIR := $(STEPS_DIR)/dev/outputs
+TEMP_DIR := $(shell mktemp -d)
+
+tutorial:
+	rm -r $(DEV_OUTPUTS_DIR) || true
+	mkdir $(DEV_OUTPUTS_DIR)
+	harness-runner ../../../../../_data/harnesses/console-consumer-produer-basic/kafka.yml $(TEMP_DIR)
+	#bash -c "diff --strip-trailing-cr $(STEPS_DIR)/dev/expected-output-step-one.txt <(head -n 4 $(DEV_OUTPUTS_DIR)/actual-output-step-one.txt)"

nodes.bodyText: these harness-XXX console consumer files are needed so the console consumer will shut down during test harness run after it consumes the expected number of records.

Added a new card for basic Kafka tutorials.  Not sure of the name, suggestions very welcome.
@colinhicks I'll need lots of help with the formatting! Do we need a new card?

nodes.bodyText: At some point, there may be another tutorial to do this with Avro (and Protobuf and JSON) with Schema Registry.  Just being cognizant of that, does this naming & problem description take into account those future tutorials?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -257,3 +257,14 @@ naming-changelog-repartition-topics:
     ksql: disabled
     kstreams: enabled
     kafka: disabled
+
+console-consumer-produer-basic:
+  title: "Console Consumer and Producer Basics"
+  meta-description: "Produce and consume your first message with Kafka"
+  slug: "/kafka-console-consumer-producer-basics"
+  problem: "you are brand new to Kafka and you want to experiment by producing and consuming a message quickly"

nodes.bodyText: For consideration: there is also --max-messages flag.  I think ctrl-c may still be the better option, but just wanted to mention the flag.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@ +Next let's open up a console consumer again, but this time you'll ready everthing that your producer has sent to the topic. you created in the previous step. + +Run this command in a new terminal to start the consumer and note the additional property `--from-beginning`: + ++++++ +
{% include_raw tutorials/console-consumer-produer-basic/kafka/code/tutorial-steps/dev/console-consumer-from-beginning.sh %}
++++++ + +After the consumer starts you should see the following output in a few seconds: + ++++++ +
{% include_raw tutorials/console-consumer-produer-basic/kafka/code/tutorial-steps/dev/expected-output-step-two.txt %}
++++++ + + +One word of caution with using the `--from-beginning` flag. As the name implies this setting forces the consumer retrieve _**every record**_ currently on the topic. So it's best to use when testing and learning and not on a production topic. + +Again, once you've recieved all records, close this console consumer by entering a `CTRL+C`.

nodes.bodyText: Is it worth explaining keys & separators, for produce?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,16 @@ +To produce your first record into Kafka, open a terminal window an run the following command: + ++++++ +
{% include_raw tutorials/console-consumer-produer-basic/kafka/code/tutorial-steps/dev/console-producer.sh %}
++++++ + +The producer will start and wait for you to enter input. Each line represents one record and to send it you'll hit the enter key. If you type multiple words then hit enter, the entire line is considered one record.

Apply suggestions from code review

Co-authored-by: Yeva Byzek <ybyzek@users.noreply.github.com>

nodes.bodyText: @ybyzek does the updated title and introduction satisfy the comments from #339 (comment)?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -268,3 +268,15 @@ cogrouping-streams:
     ksql: disabled
     kstreams: enabled
     kafka: disabled
+
+console-consumer-produer-basic:
+  title: "Console Producer and Consume Basics, no (de)serializers"
+  meta-description: "Produce and consume your first message with Kafka"
+  slug: "/kafka-console-consumer-producer-basics"
+  problem: "you are brand new to Kafka and you want to experiment by producing and consuming a message quickly"
+  introduction: "So you are excited to get started with Kafka and youd like to produce and consume some basic messages and you want to do so quickly.  In this tutorial we'll show you how to produce and consume messages from the command line with no code! Note this tutorial doesn't cover using (de)serializers. Using (de)serializers with the console consumer and producer are covered in separate tutorials"

nodes.bodyText: here you use docker exec, but below you use docker-compose exec.  IMO stick with docker-compose exec throughout.  One benefit of the docker-compose exec is that the 'interactive' flag is implied, so you wont need that like you do with docker exec

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            To produce your first record into Kafka, open a terminal window an run the following command to get an open shell on your docker container:
          
          
            
            To produce your first record into Kafka, open another terminal window and run the following command to open a second shell on the broker container:
